title: Kasama Municipal Council (Vehicle Loading and Parking Levy) By laws, 2021
content:
12th February, 2021 Statutory Instruments 41
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 10 OF 2021
The Local Government Act, 2019
(Act No. 2 of 2019)
The Kasama Municipal Council (Vehicle Loading and
Parking Levy) By-laws, 2021
IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in sections 25 and 58 of the
Local Government Act, 2019, the following By-laws are made:
1. These By-laws may be cited as the Kasama Municipal Title
Council (Vehicle Loading and Parking Levy) By laws, 2021.
2. In these By-laws, unless the context otherwise requires— Interpretation
“area” means the area under the jurisdiction of the Council;
“chief” has the meaning assigned to the word in the
Constitution; Cap. 1
“collector” means an officer or agent of the Council authorised
to collect the levy for the Council;
“Council” means the Kasama Municipal Council;
“Defence Force” means the Defence Force established under
the Constitution; Cap. 1
“heavy goods vehicle” has the meaning assigned to the words
in the Road Traffic Act, 2002; Act No. 11
of 2002
“heavy vehicle” has the meaning assigned to the words in the
Road Traffic Act, 2002; Act No. 11
of 2002
“levy” means a vehicle loading and parking levy;
“loading and parking area” means a place within an area of
the Council designated by the Council as a vehicle loading
and parking area;
“national security services” means the national security
services established under the Constitution; Cap. 1
“motor omnibus” has the meaning assigned to the words in
the Road Traffic Act, 2002; Act No. 11

Imposition of 4. (1) A person who parks and loads a vehicle within a loading
levy and parking area shall pay to a collector a levy set out in the Schedule.
(2) A collector shall, on receipt of a levy at a loading and parking
area, issue a receipt to the person paying the levy.
5. A person shall not use a loading and parking area for on-site
Prohibition loading, commercial repairs or work of any kind, or the display,
of use of on-
site parking sale or storage of goods or services.
Vehicles 6. The following are exempted from paying a levy within a
exempt from loading and parking area:
paying levy
(a) a diplomatic vehicle;
(b) a vehicle belonging to the Defence Force and national
security services;
(c) a vehicle belonging to a chief;
(d) a vehicle belonging to the Road Transport and Safety
Agency;
(e) a fire department vehicle;
(f) a hearse; and
(g) an ambulance.
Offence and 7. A person who contravenes a provision of these Bylaws
penalty commits an offence and is liable, on conviction—
(a) to a fine not exceeding fifty thousand penalty units or
imprisonment for term not exceeding six months, or to
both; and
(b) in the case of a continuing offence, a fine not exceeding
six thousand penalty units for each day that the
contravention continues.
